topic.title: Does ZeroNet fix bittorrent over tor issues?
topic.body:
https://blog.torproject.org/bittorrent-over-tor-isnt-good-idea

This blog post shows some ways bittorrent over tor can destroy anonymity. Does ZeroNet prevent these attacks in anyway? Is it integrated with tor in a way that makes this blog post irrelevant?

1511360238_17ffrcHNzbFoUe81PyMEagQdv2DGN.body: We live in a world where how much you pay to learn is more important than how much you learn. College is a way for greedy pigs to rape peoples wallets. Especially people straight out of high school who are worried about their future. Even very low level jobs are now requiring some kind of degree in the US. You pretty much cant get a single decent job without one. It never used to be that way. But hey big companies, corporations, and schools love to fuck everyone in anyway possible. The sytem shovels shit in our faces and the mindless drones of society just keep their mouths wide open because their constantly hungry for more bullshit

> [p0infl3xter](#comment_8_1BrGZNxToC56H726jqXuUNuR6M8nn9kfBN): It's only a matter of time before this situation blows up in everyone's faces because people are too poor to work.

Exactly and failure to pay student loans in time can lead to a revocation  of your license. So you basically lose your job which could at least pay some of the money to now having to resort to a minimum wage job that will make paying off your loans next to impossible.
